item.title: Terminologies
item.description:
Memory

  • Loitering: holding a reference to an object when it is no longer needed.
  • Shallow memory usage: no content memory is allocated, only the reference
  • Deep memory usage: content memory is allocated, duplicated, or initialized.

Object Oriented Design

  • Abstract class: You cannot instantiate an abstract class (make it return an object), although you can call a static method inside of it. It needs at least one abstract method. It is meant to be extended.
